result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig W. HOLTZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Methamphetamine Precursors, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.
  • Possession of Improvised Explosives, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.31(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change from DOC indicating defendant's extended supervision revoked - sentenced to prison effective 04-05-17.
All records scanned and verified.

The defendant has successfully completed the Earned Release Program as of 09-09-2016.
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days that are converted from confinement time to extended supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Cover letter.

Transcript of plea and sentencing hearing held on 09-26-14.
Copy of transcript mailed to Registrar at Dodge Correctional Institution.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Wisconsin State Prisons and Extended Supervision.  Duplicate original delivered to Registrar.  Copy to DOC and Sheriff.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.  
State moves to delete the repeater enhancers on Count 2 and Count 4.  Motion granted.  
Count 2 - Possess Methamphetamine Precursors - No contest plea.  
Count 4 - Possession of Improvised Explosives - No contest plea.  Convicted.  
Staet moves to dismiss and read in count 1, possess drug paraphernalia to manufacture methamphetamine as repeater and count 3, knowingly possess methamphetamine waste as repeater.  Motion granted.   
Defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total sentence of forty-eight (48) months on each count concurrent.  Eighteen (18) months initial confinement, on each count, concurrent, followed by thirty (30) months extended supervision, but consecutive to Case No. 12 CF 221.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  Conditions of extended supervision are:
1) Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process;
2) Submit to random urine screens and pay for same;
3) Maintain full-time employment/job search combination;
4) Have no contact with any known drug users/dealers/manufacturers;
5) Pay costs of action;
6) Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-21-14 at 2:00 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Michael Fenn.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
